Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Fictional \Fic"tion*al\, a. Pertaining to, or characterized by, fiction; fictitious; romantic.``Fictional rather than historical.'' --Latham. [1913 Webster]

fictional adj 1: related to or involving literary fiction; "clever fictional devices"; "a fictional treatment of the train robbery" [ant: {nonfictional}] 2: formed or conceived by the imagination; "a fabricated excuse for his absence"; "a fancied wrong"; "a fictional character"; "used fictitious names"; "a made-up story" [syn: {fabricated}, {fancied}, {fictitious}, {invented}, {made-up}]
